body.p: This deal was found by Bert Beentjes.

Nobody can make or any two-level contract. So that leaves one-level contracts. Can East/West make ? Against spades, the defense runs three clubs, the diamond ace, and the heart ace. North then leads a fourth club at this position:
If East pitches or ruffs low, South ruffs with the spade queen, which gives North/South two trump tricks.
If East ruffs high, North/South also get two trump tricks.
East/West cannot make , but perversely, North/South can.

To avoid the promotion, East/West might start with the king and ace of trumps, and then attack diamonds.
South wins the diamond ace, crosses to the club king, plays the trump jack, and then finesses in clubs. South then cashes the club ace, and leads a low heart.

If West plays small on the heart, win the ace and exit to West in hearts leading to this position:
West, stuck on lead, must give up a trick in diamonds.

If West plays the heart king on the first heart, North plays low, and West is stuck on lead at this position:
West can't lead diamonds without giving up a seventh trick to North/South. If he exits imeddiately in hearts, North wins the ace and leads the club jack. West must ruff this, and now is stuck leading diamonds. And if West plays of his trumps before exiting in hearts, North scores the club jack.
So par on this board is by North/South.
